intro: Tragia prostrata, commonly known as prostrate tragia, is a low-growing annual plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant has hairy, branching stems that lie close to the ground, and its small, yellow flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with serrated edges, and the plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Tragia prostrata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
